action.action-desc: Ms. Caraveo (for herself, Mr. Lamborn, Ms. Pettersen, and Mr. Neguse) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To direct the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and Secretary of Commerce to submit to Congress a report on the merits of, and options for, establishing an institute relating to space resources, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Space Resources Institute Act.

section.header: Report on merits and options for establishing an institute relating to space resources

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Administrator and Secretary shall jointly submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report on the merits of, and options for, establishing an institute relating to space resources to advance the objectives of NASA and the Department in maintaining United States preeminence in space. Such objectives shall include the following:

paragraph.text: Identifying, developing, and distributing space resources, including by encouraging the development of foundational science and technology.
Reducing the technological risks associated with identifying, developing, and distributing space resources.
Developing options for using space resources to—

subparagraph.text: support current and future space architectures, programs, and missions; and
enable such architectures, programs, and missions that would not otherwise be possible.

subsection.text: The report required under subsection (a) shall also include the following assessments of the Administrator and the Secretary:

paragraph.text: Whether a virtual or physical institute relating to space resources is most cost effective and appropriate.

Whether partnering with institutions of higher education and the aerospace industry, and the extractive industry as appropriate, would be effective in increasing information available to the institute with respect to advancing the objectives described in subsection (a).
The term Administrator means the Administrator of NASA.
The term appropriate congressional committees means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate.

paragraph.text: The term Department means the Department of Commerce.
The term extractive industry means companies and individuals involved in the processes of extracting, including mining, quarrying, drilling, and dredging, raw, natural materials or energy sources.
The term institution of higher education has the meaning given such term in section 101(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001(a)).
The term NASA means the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Commerce.

subparagraph.text: The term space resource means an abiotic resource in situ in outer space.
The term space resource includes a raw, natural material or energy source.
